name: HOLIDAY SHIPPING NOTICE
description:
The holidays are right around the corner. During holiday seasons, QuellyRue Designs will continue to make every effort to ship your order as quickly as possible, however, please note that order processing time may increase as every item is handmade.

For Christmas orders, please be sure to place your orders by Friday, November 29th when choosing standard shipping method. Orders are shipped out within 1-2+ weeks during business (working) days, Monday thru Friday. These exclude any holidays and weekends. Orders are generally delivered within 2-3 days of the SHIPMENT date. Please note that during the holiday seasons, delivery may be delayed due to high volume. We do NOT guarantee your order will be delivered in time for the holidays if placed after November 29th. We do NOT offer expedite shipping and Second-Day options during holiday seasons.

Thank you for your patience and understanding!

name: Daily Reminder Krobo Bracelet
description:
Life comes at you in all directions. These inspirational bracelets are there with you when you need a little uplifting. Just a peek at your bracelet and there's the encouragement you need no matter where you may be.

Krobo beads. Elastic band. One size fits all.

No two are exactly alike.

options.name: Reality has limits, imagination is boundless
Encourage your hopes, not your fears
Know in your heart you are loved
Dream as if you will live forever

name: Umoja Unity Earrings
description:
Intertwined hoop earrings fashioned using African Ankara fabrics from Ghana!

Measure 4 inches long and are lightweight on the ear.

Please specify your earring of choice *by number* at checkout.

Show your style and have some fun with these lovely earrings!

name: Odumase Krobo Bracelet
description:
A beautiful charm bracelet that features bold African Krobo beads, gold pearls, and lovely shades of rich caramel and luminous earthy gems.

Elastic band. One size fits all.

Show your style and have some fun with these lovely bracelets!

name: Gye Nyame...
description:
Gye Nyame is an Adinkra symbol that means "except for God", the supremacy and omnipotence of God. This unique and beautiful symbol is ubiquitous in Ghana. It is by far the most popular for use in decoration, a reflection on the deeply religious character of the Ghanaian people

These wooden earrings are hand-painted gold. They measure 3" and are light weight on the ear.

Show your style and have some fun with these lovely earrings!

name: Ankara Bangle
description:
Aren't these bangles delightful? 

Brightly colored batik, geometric tribal prints, and rich with African heritage!

Choose ONE. Please specify your bangle of choice *by number* at checkout.

• Slip-on, no closure
• Satin ribbon lining
• Measures 1½'' wide
• 7¾'' circumference
• 2½'' in diameter
• All measurements are approximate

Fit - Small/Medium

name: Kente Wallet
description:
Make a bold fashion statement with this wallet made from authentic hand-woven Kente fabric from Ghana!

Historically, kente was reserved for special occasions, both festive and sacred. Kente also stands as a symbol of prestige, cheerfulness and glamour. 

This wallet is fully lined and includes an extra pocket that closes with a zipper. The wallet fastens with a velcro button under the flap.

Measures 8" x 4'.

Symbolic meanings of the colors:

Black—maturation, intensified spiritual energy
Blue—peacefulness, harmony and love
Green—vegetation, planting, harvesting, growth, spiritual renewal
Gold—royalty, wealth, high status, glory, spiritual purity
Grey—healing and cleansing rituals; associated with ash
Maroon—the color of mother earth; associated with healing
Pink—assoc. with the female essence of life; a mild, gentle aspect of red
Purple—assoc. with feminine aspects of life; usually worn by women
Red—political and spiritual moods; bloodshed; sacrificial rites and death.
Silver—serenity, purity, joy; assoc. with the moon
White—purification, sanctification rites and festive occasions
Yellow—preciousness, royalty, wealth, fertility

name: Ohema Kente Clutch
description:
Make a bold fashion statement with this clutch made from authentic hand-woven Kente fabric from Ghana!

According to Ashanti Kente traditions, yellow stands for vitality, spirituality and wealth, whereas green symbolizes prosperity and spiritual rejuvenation. Maroon stands for the color of mother earth; associated with healing, and black symbolizes maturation and intensified spiritual energy. 

Historically, kente was reserved for special occasions, both festive and sacred. Kente also stands as a symbol of prestige, cheerfulness and glamour. 

This clutch is fully lined and includes a strap, and a pocket that closes with a zipper. The bag fastens with a velcro button under the flap.

Measurements:

Bag: 16.1 inches H x 10.2 inches W x 3.2 inches D
Strap: 1.2 inches W x 11.0 inches H

Care instructions: DRY CLEAN ONLY

name: Cowrie Shell Studs
description:
Indulge in a bit of seaside charm and look glam at the same time with these cute cowrie shell stud earrings!

Earrings are attached to the gold plated ear posts and measure approx. 2,5 x 2 cm . Each pair includes earring backings.

Show your style and have some fun with these lovely earrings!

name: Ankara Bow Clip
description: Each hair clip measures approximately 5"(L) x 3(W). The clip unattached, so you can take it off completely and use a pin to wear it as a broach.

name: Dwennimmen Ram's Horns Adinkra Earrings
description:
Dwennimmen "ram's horns" is an African Adinkra symbol of humility together with strength.

The ram will fight fiercely against an adversary, but it also submits humbly to slaughter, emphasizing that even the strong need to be humble.

Made of wood, these golden earrings measure 3" and are light weight on the ear.

Show your style and have some fun with these lovely earrings!
